block.p: INTERNATIONAL 3-17

A Post-Occupation Iraq Behind the debate over troop withdrawal from Iraq is widespread concern about what the country would look like after American troops left. Wide-ranging interviews with Iraqis found a surprising consensus with American commanders' views that a troop withdrawal soon would allow sectarian violence to run wild and might implode the government.

American, British and Iraqi forces battled fighters from the Mahdi Army militia in Baghdad and Basra, a day after the militia's leader came out of hiding. Also, the deaths of 11 American service members were announced, bringing the total this month to at least 101. 14
Israel Bombs Hamas Facilities Israel bombed a series of Hamas facilities in Gaza, killing at least five Palestinians, and arrested another cabinet minister from Hamas. 16
South Korea's Skyscraper Rush South Korea, in an effort to keep up with its booming neighbors, has become an unexpected player in the worldwide rush to erect ever taller buildings.

Ukraine Crisis Defused Ukraine's battling political rivals agreed to hold new parliamentary elections, defusing a political crisis that had escalated with President Viktor A. Yushchenko's decision to order extra Interior Ministry troops to the capital, Kiev.
NATIONAL 18-25

Democrats Split on Fox Debate The decision by the three leading Democratic presidential candidates to shun a debate to be broadcast on Fox News has sharpened a wedge between the Congressional Black Caucus, which is co-sponsoring the debate, and liberals who disagree with the network's conservative commentary. 1

Aiding College Diversity Concerned that the barriers to elite institutions are being increasingly drawn along class lines, many top colleges are actively recruiting low-income students and considering economic status when making admissions decisions.

Alaska Villages Threatened Global climate change threatens about 180 villages in Alaska, including some that could be washed away within a decade. The towns are sinking as the permafrost beneath them melts, and powerful storms bolstered by changes in sea ice are eroding the shoreline.

Company Pulls Lens Solution A contact lens solution manufacturer voluntarily withdrew its product after federal health officials said an investigation had linked it to a rare but potentially blinding eye infection.
NEW YORK/REGION 27-30

Rise of the City Homeowner Thanks to a building boom and the availability of low-interest and risky subprime mortgages, one in three New York households now own their dwellings, and the number of homes and apartments occupied by their owners has passed one million for the first time, according to a new analysis of census results. 27

Violence's Stubborn Reign There is no better place to observe the progress and pitfalls of Newark's campaign against crime than the Fifth Precinct, four square miles in the city's southwest corner that remains Newark's most violent area. 1
